intro: Ambrosina spirialis, commonly known as the spiral ambrosia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of white and pale yellow. Its botanical classification places it within the family Asteraceae, also known as the sunflower family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Ambrosina spirialis is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
